reschedule.translation[0].definitions[0]: to arrange for something to happen at a different time from the one that was previously planned
The press conference had to be rescheduled for March 19.
reschedule.translation[0].definitions[1]: to arrange for a debt to be paid back later than was previously agreed
reschedule.translation[1].definitions[0]: to make new arrangements for the payment of a debt, loan etc, often because the person, company, or country owing the money cannot pay it back in the time agreed earlier
Faced with mounting losses, the airlinerescheduled payments for its new aircraft.
The company reached an agreement with its bankers to reschedule C$560 million in debt.
reschedule.translation[1].definitions[1]: to arrange a new time or date for a meeting or event
The shareholders meeting has been rescheduled for June 4.
